title: Consumer Cos Down On Trade-War Fallout Fears — Consumer Roundup
text:
Shares of retailers and other consumer-services companies fell amid fears rising tensions between the U.S. and China would jeopardize economic growth.

Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said tariffs were unlikely to cause a sustained increase in inflation because they were a one-time price increase.

Pizza delivery pioneer Domino's Pizza warned it expects sales growth to be slower than it had anticipated over the next few years, as it contends with increased competition spurred by the proliferation of food-delivery options.

Write to Rob Curran at rob.curran@dowjones.com

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 08, 2019 17:13 ET (21:13 GMT)
